title: Quiz 9: Advocacy, Networking & Mobilization
topicName: Principles & Practice of Health Promotion I
description: Test your knowledge on key strategies like Advocacy, Networking, and the steps of Social Mobilization (ACSM).

questions.question: What is the primary goal of Advocacy in health promotion?

options.text: To make a health issue a political or national priority

questions.explanation: Advocacy aims to gain political commitment and make issues a priority that cannot be ignored.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ is defined as working collaboratively across disciplines, sectors, and partners to enhance impact and sustainability.
questions.explanation: Networking involves building relationships and collaborating to avoid duplication and share information.

questions.question: Match the ACSM step to its activity:

pairs.right: Divide populations into groups with similar needs

questions.hint: Match the step name to what you actually DO.

questions.question: Social Mobilization is primarily about:

options.text: People organizing to collectively think and act on their development

questions.explanation: Social mobilization is about collective action and organizing communities.

questions.question: Which of the following are types of communication skills? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Communication includes Verbal, Non-verbal, and Written forms.

questions.question: Order the first 4 steps of developing an ACSM campaign:
questions.explanation: 1. Analyze -> 2. Segment Audience -> 3. Set Objectives -> 4. Define Strategy.

questions.question: Written communication is the only form of communication where messages can be edited and rectified before being sent.
questions.explanation: Unlike verbal or non-verbal, written communication allows for editing and correction prior to transmission.
questions.hint: Can you delete a spoken word?

questions.question: What is the term for identifying specific groups within a population that have similar communication needs?
questions.explanation: Audience segmentation divides a broad population into subsets with common needs.

questions.question: Which strategy is described as 'speaking up for the voiceless'?
questions.explanation: Advocacy involves representing the interests of those who cannot speak for themselves.

questions.question: Networking is useful for avoiding duplication of efforts among different agencies.
questions.explanation: Networking helps coordinate activities so agencies don't do the same work twice.
